GET_NEXTFLOW_SOFTWARE_VERSION_FOR_MIRNA_.string_process:
process GET_NEXTFLOW_SOFTWARE_VERSION_FOR_MIRNA_ANALYSIS {
   publishDir "${params.outdir}/pipeline_info", mode: params.publish_dir_mode

   output:
   path ("*.txt"), emit: software_version
   script:
   """
   echo $workflow.manifest.version > v_pipeline.txt
   echo $workflow.nextflow.version > v_nextflow.txt
   """
}

GET_FASTQC_SOFTWARE_VERSION_FOR_MIRNA_AN.string_process:
process GET_FASTQC_SOFTWARE_VERSION_FOR_MIRNA_ANALYSIS {
   label 'fastqc'
   publishDir "${params.outdir}/pipeline_info", mode: params.publish_dir_mode

   output:
   path ("*.txt"), emit: software_version
   script:
   """
   fastqc --version > v_fastqc.txt
   """
}

tools_dico.name: FastQC
tools_dico.description: This tool aims to provide a QC report which can spot problems or biases which originate either in the sequencer or in the starting library material. It can be run in one of two modes. It can either run as a stand alone interactive application for the immediate analysis of small numbers of FastQ files, or it can be run in a non-interactive mode where it would be suitable for integrating into a larger analysis pipeline for the systematic processing of large numbers of files.

}

tools_dico.name: MultiQC
tools_dico.description: MultiQC aggregates results from multiple bioinformatics analyses across many samples into a single report. It searches a given directory for analysis logs and compiles a HTML report. It's a general use tool, perfect for summarising the output from numerous bioinformatics tools.

GREP_SPECIFIED_SPECIES_MATURE_MIRNA_SEQU.string_process:
process GREP_SPECIFIED_SPECIES_MATURE_MIRNA_SEQUENCE_OF_INPUT_MATURE_FASTA{
  label 'seqkit'
  publishDir "${params.outdir}/reference_prepare/mature", mode: params.publish_dir_mode
  input:
  path mature
  output:
  path ("mature_sps.fa"), emit: fasta
  script:
  """
  seqkit grep -r --pattern \".*${params.species}-.*\" $mature > mature_sps.fa
  """
}

CONVERT_SPECIFIED_SPECIES_MATURE_MIRNA_R.string_process:
process CONVERT_SPECIFIED_SPECIES_MATURE_MIRNA_RNA_SEQUENCE_TO_DNA_SEQUENCE {
  label 'seqkit'
  publishDir "${params.outdir}/reference_prepare/mature", mode: params.publish_dir_mode
  input:
  path mature
  output:
  path ("mature_igenome.fa"), emit: fasta
  script:
  """
  seqkit seq --rna2dna $mature > mature_igenome.fa
  """
}

FASTA_FROMATTER_FOR_SPECIFIED_SPECIES_MA.string_process:
process FASTA_FROMATTER_FOR_SPECIFIED_SPECIES_MATURE_MIRNA_DNA_SEQUENCE{
  label 'fastx_toolkit'
  publishDir "${params.outdir}/reference_prepare/mature", mode: params.publish_dir_mode
  input:
  path mature
  output:
  path ("mature_idx.fa"), emit: fasta
  script:
  """
  fasta_formatter -w 0 -i $mature -o mature_idx.fa
  """
}

BOWTIE_BUILD_INDEX_FOR_FORMATTED_SPECIFI.string_process:
process BOWTIE_BUILD_INDEX_FOR_FORMATTED_SPECIFIED_SPECIES_MATURE_MIRNA_DNA_SEQUENCE {
  label 'bowtie'
  input:
  path mature
  output:
  path 'bowtie' , emit:index
  script:
  """
  mkdir bowtie
  bowtie-build --threads $task.cpus $mature bowtie/${mature.baseName}
  """
}

tools_dico.name: Bowtie
tools_dico.description: Bowtie is an ultrafast, memory-efficient short read aligner.

FASTQC_QUALITY_CHECK_FOR_RAW_READS.string_process:
process FASTQC_QUALITY_CHECK_FOR_RAW_READS {
    label 'fastqc'
    tag "$sample"
    publishDir "${params.outdir}/reads_qc/raw_reads", mode: params.publish_dir_mode
    input:
    tuple val(sample), path (reads)
    output:
    tuple val(sample), path("*.html"), emit: html
    tuple val(sample), path("*.zip") , emit: zip
    script:

    """
    fastqc --threads $task.cpus ${reads}       
    """
}

tools_dico.name: FastQC
tools_dico.description: This tool aims to provide a QC report which can spot problems or biases which originate either in the sequencer or in the starting library material. It can be run in one of two modes. It can either run as a stand alone interactive application for the immediate analysis of small numbers of FastQ files, or it can be run in a non-interactive mode where it would be suitable for integrating into a larger analysis pipeline for the systematic processing of large numbers of files.

TRIM_GALORE_RAW_READS_FILTER.string_process:
process TRIM_GALORE_RAW_READS_FILTER {
    label 'trim_galore'
    tag "$reads"
    publishDir "${params.outdir}/reads_qc/trim_galore", mode: params.publish_dir_mode

    input:
    tuple val(sample), path (reads)

    output:
    tuple val(sample),path ("*.gz"), emit:reads
    tuple val(sample),path ("*trimming_report.txt"), emit: trimgalore_results
    script:
    tg_length = "--length ${params.min_length}"
    c_r1 = clip_R1 > 0 ? "--clip_R1 ${clip_R1}" : ''
    tpc_r1 = three_prime_clip_R1 > 0 ? "--three_prime_clip_R1 ${three_prime_clip_R1}" : ''
    tpa = (protocol == "qiaseq" | protocol == "cats") ? "--adapter ${three_prime_adapter}" : '--small_rna'
    """
    trim_galore --adapter ${three_prime_adapter} $tg_length $c_r1 $tpc_r1 --max_length 100 --gzip $reads
    """
}
TRIM_GALORE_RAW_READS_FILTER.string_script:
tg_length = "--length ${params.min_length}"
    c_r1 = clip_R1 > 0 ? "--clip_R1 ${clip_R1}" : ''
    tpc_r1 = three_prime_clip_R1 > 0 ? "--three_prime_clip_R1 ${three_prime_clip_R1}" : ''
    tpa = (protocol == "qiaseq" | protocol == "cats") ? "--adapter ${three_prime_adapter}" : '--small_rna'
    """
    trim_galore --adapter ${three_prime_adapter} $tg_length $c_r1 $tpc_r1 --max_length 100 --gzip $reads
    """

tools_dico.name: BitPAI
tools_dico.description: A bit-parallel algorithm for general, integer-scoring global alignment. Integer-scoring schemes assign integer weights for match, mismatch and insertion/deletion. This method uses structural properties in the relationship between adjacent scores in the scoring matrix to construct classes of efficient algorithms, each designed for a particular set of weights.

process FASTQC_QUALITY_CHECK_FOR_TRIMMED_READS {

BOWTIE_ALIGNMENT_FOR_FILTERED_CLEAN_READ.string_process:
process BOWTIE_ALIGNMENT_FOR_FILTERED_CLEAN_READS_WITH_MATURE_MIRNA_INDEX {
    tag "sample"
    label 'bowtie'
    publishDir "${params.outdir}/bowtie_mapping/mature", mode: params.publish_dir_mode
    
    input:
    tuple val(sample), path(reads)
    path  index

    output:
    tuple val(sample), path('*.bam'), emit: bam
    tuple val(sample), path('*.out'), emit: log
    tuple val(sample), path('*fastq.gz'), optional:true, emit: fastq

    script:
    seq_center = params.seq_center ? "--sam-RG ID:${sample} --sam-RG 'CN:${params.seq_center}'" : ''
    """
    INDEX=`find -L ./ -name "*.3.ebwt" | sed 's/.3.ebwt//'`
    bowtie \\
        --threads $task.cpus \\
        --sam \\
        -x \$INDEX \\
        -q \\
        -t \\
        -k 50 \\
        --best \\
        --strata \\
        -e 99999 \\
        --chunkmbs 2048 \\
        $reads \\
        --un ${sample}.mature_unmapped.fq \\
        2> ${sample}.out \\
        | samtools view -@ $task.cpus -bS -o ${sample}.bam

    """
}
BOWTIE_ALIGNMENT_FOR_FILTERED_CLEAN_READ.string_script:
seq_center = params.seq_center ? "--sam-RG ID:${sample} --sam-RG 'CN:${params.seq_center}'" : ''
    """
    INDEX=`find -L ./ -name "*.3.ebwt" | sed 's/.3.ebwt//'`
    bowtie \\
        --threads $task.cpus \\
        --sam \\
        -x \$INDEX \\
        -q \\
        -t \\
        -k 50 \\
        --best \\
        --strata \\
        -e 99999 \\
        --chunkmbs 2048 \\
        $reads \\
        --un ${sample}.mature_unmapped.fq \\
        2> ${sample}.out \\
        | samtools view -@ $task.cpus -bS -o ${sample}.bam

    """

SAMTOOLS_SORTING_BAM_FOR_BOWTIE_UNSORTED.string_process:
process SAMTOOLS_SORTING_BAM_FOR_BOWTIE_UNSORTED_BAM_WITH_MATURE_INDEX{
    label 'samtools'
    tag "$sample"
    input:
    tuple val(sample), path (bam)
    output:
    tuple val(sample), path("*.sorted.bam") , emit:sorted_bam

    script:
    """
    samtools sort -@ $task.cpus -o ${sample}.sorted.bam -T $sample $bam
    """
}

    output:

    script:

    """
}

EXTRACT_MIRNA_SEQUENCE_BASED_ON_GENOME_F.string_process:
process EXTRACT_MIRNA_SEQUENCE_BASED_ON_GENOME_FASTA_AND_MIRBASE_GFF{

  label 'gffread'
  publishDir "${params.outdir}/reference_prepare/salmon",mode: params.publish_dir_mode
  input:
  path genome
  path gff3

  output:
  path ("salmon_input_transcripts.fa"), emit: fasta
  script:
  """
  gffread \\
    -w transcripts.fa.tmp \\
    -g ${genome} \\
    $gtf
  awk '{ if(/^>/){print \$1}else{print \$0}}' transcripts.fa.tmp > salmon_input_transcripts.fa
  """
}
EXTRACT_MIRNA_SEQUENCE_BASED_ON_GENOME_F.string_script:
"""
  gffread \\
    -w transcripts.fa.tmp \\
    -g ${genome} \\
    $gtf

SALMON_QUANT_FOR_CLEAN_READS_WITH_PREVIO.string_process:
process SALMON_QUANT_FOR_CLEAN_READS_WITH_PREVIOUS_BUILD_INDEX{
    label 'salmon'
    tag "${sample}"
    publishDir "${params.outdir}/miRNA_quantify/salmon_quant",mode: params.publish_dir_mode

    input:
    tuple val(sample), path (reads)
    path  index
    path gtf 
    output:
    tuple val(sample),path ("${sample}") , emit:results
    script:
    def strandedness = params.single_end ? 'U' : 'IU'
    def input_reads = params.single_end ? "-r $reads" : "-1 ${reads[0]} -2 ${reads[1]}"
    """
    salmon quant \\
        --geneMap $gtf \\
        --threads $task.cpus \\
        --libType=$strandedness \\
        --index $index \\
        $input_reads\\
        -o $sample
    """
}
SALMON_QUANT_FOR_CLEAN_READS_WITH_PREVIO.string_script:
def strandedness = params.single_end ? 'U' : 'IU'
    def input_reads = params.single_end ? "-r $reads" : "-1 ${reads[0]} -2 ${reads[1]}"
    """
    salmon quant \\
        --geneMap $gtf \\
        --threads $task.cpus \\
        --libType=$strandedness \\
        --index $index \\
        $input_reads\\
        -o $sample
    """

tools_dico.name: Salmon
tools_dico.description: A tool for transcript expression quantification from RNA-seq data

BOWTIE_ALIGNMENT_FOR_FILTERED_CLEAN_READ.string_process:
process BOWTIE_ALIGNMENT_FOR_FILTERED_CLEAN_READS_WITH_GENOME_INDEX {
    tag "sample"
    label 'bowtie'
    publishDir "${params.outdir}/bowtie_mapping/genome", mode: params.publish_dir_mode
    
    input:
    tuple val(sample), path(reads)
    path  index

    output:
    tuple val(sample), path('*.bam'), emit: bam
    tuple val(sample), path('*.out'), emit: log
    tuple val(sample), path('*fastq.gz'), optional:true, emit: fastq

    script:
    seq_center = params.seq_center ? "--sam-RG ID:${sample} --sam-RG 'CN:${params.seq_center}'" : ''
    """
    INDEX=`find -L ./ -name "*.3.ebwt" | sed 's/.3.ebwt//'`
    bowtie \\
        --threads $task.cpus \\
        --sam \\
        -x \$INDEX \\
        -q \\
        -t \\
        -k 50 \\
        --best \\
        --strata \\
        -e 99999 \\
        --chunkmbs 2048 \\
        $reads \\
        --un ${sample}.mature_unmapped.fq \\
        2> ${sample}.out \\
        | samtools view -@ $task.cpus -bS -o ${sample}.bam

    """
}
BOWTIE_ALIGNMENT_FOR_FILTERED_CLEAN_READ.string_script:
seq_center = params.seq_center ? "--sam-RG ID:${sample} --sam-RG 'CN:${params.seq_center}'" : ''

    INDEX=`find -L ./ -name "*.3.ebwt" | sed 's/.3.ebwt//'`
    bowtie \\

        -x \$INDEX \\
        -q \\
        -t \\
        -k 50 \\
        --best \\
        --strata \\
        -e 99999 \\
        --chunkmbs 2048 \\
        $reads \\
        --un ${sample}.mature_unmapped.fq \\
        2> ${sample}.out \\
        | samtools view -@ $task.cpus -bS -o ${sample}.bam

    """

tools_dico.name: Bowtie
tools_dico.description: Bowtie is an ultrafast, memory-efficient short read aligner.

tools_dico.name: SAMtools
tools_dico.description: A software package with various utilities for processing alignments in the SAM format, including variant calling and alignment viewing.

SAMTOOLS_SORTING_BAM_FOR_BOWTIE_UNSORTED.string_process:
process SAMTOOLS_SORTING_BAM_FOR_BOWTIE_UNSORTED_BAM_WITH_GENOME_INDEX{
    label 'samtools'
    tag "$sample"
    input:
    tuple val(sample), path (bam)
    output:
    tuple val(sample), path("*.sorted.bam") , emit:sorted_bam

    script:
    """
    samtools sort -@ $task.cpus -o ${sample}.sorted.bam -T $sample $bam
    """

}

tools_dico.name: SAMtools
tools_dico.description: A software package with various utilities for processing alignments in the SAM format, including variant calling and alignment viewing.

SAMTOOLS_INDEX_FOR_BOWTIE_MAPPED_BAM_WIT.string_process:
process SAMTOOLS_INDEX_FOR_BOWTIE_MAPPED_BAM_WITH_GENOME_INDEX {
    label 'samtools'
    tag "$sample"
    publishDir "${params.outdir}/bam_report/genome/idx_statistics",mode: params.publish_dir_mode

    input:
    tuple val(sample), path (bam)

    output:
    tuple val(sample), path("*.idxstats"), emit: idxstats

    script:

    """
    samtools index $bam
    samtools idxstats $bam > ${bam}.idxstats

    """
}

tools_dico.name: SAMtools
tools_dico.description: A software package with various utilities for processing alignments in the SAM format, including variant calling and alignment viewing.

SAMTOOLS_STAT_FOR_BOWTIE_MAPPED_BAM_WITH.string_process:
process SAMTOOLS_STAT_FOR_BOWTIE_MAPPED_BAM_WITH_GENOME_INDEX {
    label 'samtools'
    tag "$sample"
    publishDir "${params.outdir}/bam_report/genome/statistics",mode: params.publish_dir_mode

    input:
    tuple val(sample), path (bam)

    output:
    tuple val(sample), path("*.stats"), emit: stats

    script:

    """
    samtools stats $bam > ${bam}.stats

    """
}

tools_dico.name: SAMtools
tools_dico.description: A software package with various utilities for processing alignments in the SAM format, including variant calling and alignment viewing.

SAMTOOLS_FLAGSTAT_FOR_BOWTIE_MAPPED_BAM_.string_process:
process SAMTOOLS_FLAGSTAT_FOR_BOWTIE_MAPPED_BAM_WITH_GENOME_INDEX{
    label 'samtools'
    tag "$sample"
    publishDir "${params.outdir}/bam_report/genome/flag_statistics",mode: params.publish_dir_mode

    input:
    tuple val(sample), path (bam)

    output:

    tuple val(sample), path("*.flagstat"), emit: flagstat

    script:

    """
}

tools_dico.name: SAMtools
tools_dico.description: A software package with various utilities for processing alignments in the SAM format, including variant calling and alignment viewing.

HTSEQ_COUNTS_FOR_FOR_BOWTIE_MAPPED_BAM_W.string_process:
process HTSEQ_COUNTS_FOR_FOR_BOWTIE_MAPPED_BAM_WITH_GENOME_INDEX {
    label 'htseq'
    tag "$sample"
    publishDir "${params.outdir}/miRNA_quantify/htseq-count",mode: params.publish_dir_mode

    input:
    tuple val(sample), path (bam)
    path gtf

    output:

    tuple val(sample), path("*txt"), emit: results

    script:

    """
    htseq-count -f bam -s no $bam $gtf > ${sample}.txt

    """
}

tools_dico.name: htseqcount
tools_dico.description: This script takes an alignment file in SAM format and a feature file in GFF format and calculates for each feature the number of reads mapping to it.

FEATURE_COUNTS_FOR_FOR_BOWTIE_MAPPED_BAM.string_process:
process FEATURE_COUNTS_FOR_FOR_BOWTIE_MAPPED_BAM_WITH_GENOME_INDEX {
    label 'featurecounts'
    tag "$sample"
    publishDir "${params.outdir}/miRNA_quantify/featureCounts",mode: params.publish_dir_mode

    input:
    tuple val(sample), path (bam)
    path gtf

    output:

    tuple val(sample), path("*txt"), emit: results

    script:

    """
    featureCounts \\
    -T $task.cpus \\
    -F gff \\
    -M \\
    -t miRNA \\
    -g Name \\
    -a $gtf \\
    -o ${sample}.txt \\
    $bam

    """
}

tools_dico.name: FeatureCounts
tools_dico.description: featureCounts is a very efficient read quantifier. It can be used to summarize RNA-seq reads and gDNA-seq reads to a variety of genomic features such as genes, exons, promoters, gene bodies and genomic bins. It is included in the Bioconductor Rsubread package and also in the SourceForge Subread package.

MERGE_HTSEQ_COUNTS_RESULTS.string_process:
process MERGE_HTSEQ_COUNTS_RESULTS {  

  input:
  path ('htseq_counts_results/*')
  output:
  path ('counts.txt'), emit: htseq_counts
  script:
  """
  ls *txt | cut -d'.' -f 1 |tr '\n' '\t' |awk '{print \$0}'| sed 's/^/'\\t'&/g' > counts.file
  paste *.txt | awk '{printf \$1"\t";for(i=2;i<=NF;i+=2) printf \$i"\t";printf \$i"\n"}' > reads_count.txt  
  cat reads_count.txt >> counts.file
  mv counts.file counts.txt
  """
}
MERGE_HTSEQ_COUNTS_RESULTS.string_script:
"""
  ls *txt | cut -d'.' -f 1 |tr '\n' '\t' |awk '{print \$0}'| sed 's/^/'\\t'&/g' > counts.file
  paste *.txt | awk '{printf \$1"\t";for(i=2;i<=NF;i+=2) printf \$i"\t";printf \$i"\n"}' > reads_count.txt  
  cat reads_count.txt >> counts.file
  mv counts.file counts.txt
  """

MULTIQC_FOR_RAW_READS_FASTQC_RESULTS.string_process:
process MULTIQC_FOR_RAW_READS_FASTQC_RESULTS {
    label 'multiqc'
    publishDir "${params.outdir}/Analysis_Report/raw_reads_fastqc", mode: params.publish_dir_mode

    input:
    path ('fastqc/*')
    
    output:
    path "*multiqc_report.html", emit: report
    path "*_data"              , emit: data
    path "*_plots"             , optional:true, emit: plots

    script:
    """
    multiqc -f --export fastqc/
    """
}

tools_dico.name: MultiQC
tools_dico.description: MultiQC aggregates results from multiple bioinformatics analyses across many samples into a single report. It searches a given directory for analysis logs and compiles a HTML report. It's a general use tool, perfect for summarising the output from numerous bioinformatics tools.
